summary: Email exchange between Jeffrey Epstein and Boris Nikolic regarding a draft agreement forwarded from Larry Cohen, which includes non-disparagement clauses, confidentiality, mutual release of legal claims, and the end of Nikolic's employment with bgC3. The email contains a confidentiality notice claiming attorney-client privilege.

persons.name: Boris Nikolic
persons.context: Receives and responds to an email from Jeffrey Epstein regarding a draft agreement, requesting changes to the end date and a point about job assistance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Forwards an email from Larry Cohen containing draft agreement points to Boris Nikolic and corresponds about modifications.

persons.name: Larry Cohen
persons.context: Authored the draft agreement points sent to Jeffrey Epstein, which include mutual non-disparagement, confidentiality, release of legal claims, and employment termination details.

persons.name: Bill Gates
persons.context: Listed as the signatory on the draft agreement points forwarded by Larry Cohen, which pertains to the termination of employment and legal releases.

connections.description: Email exchange discusses the end of Nikolic's employment with bgC3 (an entity related to Epstein) and agreement terms, indicating a professional relationship.
Cohen sends draft agreement points to Epstein for input, suggesting a collaborative or advisory relationship.
Draft agreement indicates Nikolic's employment with bgC3 (associated with Gates) will end, and Gates is to provide references.
Epstein is forwarding an agreement where Gates is the signatory, relating to Nikolic's employment with Gates' entity bgC3.

events.title: Termination of Employment
events.description: The draft agreement states that Boris Nikolic's employment with bgC3 will end on January 1, 2014.

events.title: Email Exchange on Agreement
events.description: Email correspondence between Jeffrey Epstein and Boris Nikolic discussing modifications to a draft agreement forwarded from Larry Cohen.

keyFacts: The document is a 2013 email exchange discussing a draft legal agreement involving Jeffrey Epstein, Boris Nikolic, Larry Cohen, and Bill Gates.

The draft agreement includes mutual non-disparagement clauses, confidentiality, release of all legal claims between parties, and the termination of Nikolic's employment with bgC3 (a Gates-associated entity) effective January 1, 2014.
The email contains a confidentiality notice claiming the communication may be attorney-client privileged and is the property of Jeffrey Epstein.
Bill Gates is listed as the signatory on the draft agreement points, committing to provide positive references for Nikolic.
